api/Plugin_DeviceAddresses.DeviceAddress.keywords: Class DeviceAddresses Namespace Plugin_DeviceAddresses Assembly Plugin_DeviceAddresses.dll The DeviceAddresses plugin public class DeviceAddresses : Plugin Inheritance object Plugin DeviceAddresses Inherited Members Plugin.OnAppShutdown() Plugin.OnAppStartup() Plugin.OnSearchWindowStartup() Plugin.OnSignifier(string) Plugin.CommandSignifiers() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors DeviceAddresses() Creates the plugin, loading the plugins settings public DeviceAddresses() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> An empty list - the only way to use this plugin is through special commands OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. Provides the respective addresses or all of them if the query is the DeviceAddressesCommand public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> the respective address SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The commands in settings

api/Plugin_EnglishDictionary.EnglishDict.title: Class EnglishDictionary | QuokkaDocs
api/Plugin_EnglishDictionary.EnglishDict.keywords: Class EnglishDictionary Namespace Plugin_EnglishDictionary Assembly Plugin_EnglishDictionary.dll The English Dictionary Plugin public class EnglishDictionary : Plugin Inheritance object Plugin EnglishDictionary Inherited Members Plugin.OnAppShutdown() Plugin.OnAppStartup() Plugin.OnSearchWindowStartup() Plugin.OnSpecialCommand(string) Plugin.SpecialCommands() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors EnglishDictionary() Loads Plugin specific settings public EnglishDictionary() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() Used to define signifiers (prefixes) to produce commands that should take in extra information (after the prefix) to produce unique results. When a query starting with one of these signifiers is entered by the user, OnSignifier(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The signifiers defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The DictionarySignifier from plugin settings OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> An empty list - Using the command signifier is the only way to get a result from this plugin, as to not needlessly send queries to the dictionary API OnSignifier(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to include a command signifier, provided by CommandSignifiers(), at the beginning of their query. Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The DictionarySignifier (Since there is only 1 signifier for this plugin), followed by the word being defined Returns List<ListItem> List of definitions that possibly match what is being searched for

api/Plugin_Everything.Everything.html.title: Class Everything | QuokkaDocs
api/Plugin_Everything.Everything.html.keywords: Class Everything Namespace Plugin_Everything Assembly Plugin_Everything.dll The Everything Plugin public class Everything : Plugin Inheritance object Everything Constructors Everything() Sets Everything Request Flags and Max values num. Also loads the plugin's settings public Everything() Properties PluggerName The name is "Everything" public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The EverythingSignifier from plugin settings Everything_GetNumResults() The Everything_GetNumResults function returns the number of visible file and folder results. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_getnumresults/ public static extern uint Everything_GetNumResults() Returns uint Returns the number of visible file and folder results. If the function fails the return value is 0. Everything_GetResultDateModified(uint, out long) The Everything_GetResultDateModified function retrieves the modified date of a visible result. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_getresultdatemodified/ public static extern bool Everything_GetResultDateModified(uint nIndex, out long lpFileTime) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. lpFileTime long A FILETIME to hold the modified date of the result. Returns bool The function returns non-zero if successful. The function returns 0 if the modified date information is unavailable. Everything_GetResultFileName(uint) The Everything_GetResultFileName function retrieves the file name part only of the visible result. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_getresultfilename/ public static extern IntPtr Everything_GetResultFileName(uint nIndex) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. Returns IntPtr The function returns a pointer to a null terminated string of TCHARs. If the function fails the return value is NULL. Everything_GetResultFullPathName(uint, StringBuilder, uint) The Everything_GetResultFullPathName function retrieves the full path and file name of the visible result. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_getresultfullpathname/ public static extern void Everything_GetResultFullPathName(uint nIndex, StringBuilder lpString, uint nMaxCount) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. lpString StringBuilder The buffer that will receive the text. If the string is as long or longer than the buffer, the string is truncated and terminated with a NULL character. nMaxCount uint Specifies the maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL character. If the text exceeds this limit, it is truncated. Everything_GetResultSize(uint, out long) The Everything_GetResultSize function retrieves the size of a visible result. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_getresultsize/ public static extern bool Everything_GetResultSize(uint nIndex, out long lpFileSize) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. lpFileSize long Pointer to a LARGE_INTEGER to hold the size of the result. Returns bool The function returns non-zero if successful. The function returns 0 if size information is unavailable. Everything_IsFolderResult(uint) The Everything_IsFolderResult function determines if the visible result is a folder. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_isfolderresult/ public static extern bool Everything_IsFolderResult(uint nIndex) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. Returns bool The function returns TRUE, if the visible result is a folder or volume (For example: C: or c:\WINDOWS). The function returns FALSE, if the visible result is a file (For example: C:\ABC.123). If the function fails the return value is FALSE. Everything_IsVolumeResult(uint) The Everything_IsVolumeResult function determines if the visible result is the root folder of a volume. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_isvolumeresult/ public static extern bool Everything_IsVolumeResult(uint nIndex) Parameters nIndex uint Zero based index of the visible result. Returns bool The function returns TRUE, if the visible result is a volume (For example: C:). The function returns FALSE, if the visible result is a folder or file (For example: C:\ABC.123). If the function fails the return value is FALSE. Everything_QueryW(bool) The Everything_Query function executes an Everything IPC query with the current search state. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_query/ public static extern bool Everything_QueryW(bool bWait) Parameters bWait bool Should the function wait for the results or return immediately. Returns bool If the function succeeds, the return value is TRUE. If the function fails, the return value is FALSE. Everything_SetMatchCase(bool) The Everything_SetMatchCase function enables or disables case sensitivity for the next call to Everything_Query. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setmatchcase/ public static extern void Everything_SetMatchCase(bool bEnable) Parameters bEnable bool Specifies whether the search is case sensitive or insensitive. Everything_SetMatchPath(bool) The Everything_SetMatchPath function enables or disables full path matching for the next call to Everything_Query. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setmatchpath/ public static extern void Everything_SetMatchPath(bool bEnable) Parameters bEnable bool Specifies whether to enable or disable full path matching. Everything_SetMatchWholeWord(bool) The Everything_SetMatchWholeWord function enables or disables matching whole words for the next call to Everything_Query. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setmatchwholeword/ public static extern void Everything_SetMatchWholeWord(bool bEnable) Parameters bEnable bool Specifies whether the search matches whole words, or can match anywhere. Everything_SetMax(uint) The Everything_SetMax function sets the maximum number of results to return from Everything_Query. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setmax/ public static extern void Everything_SetMax(uint dwMax) Parameters dwMax uint Specifies the maximum number of results to return. Everything_SetRegex(bool) The Everything_SetRegex function enables or disables Regular Expression searching. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setregex/ public static extern void Everything_SetRegex(bool bEnable) Parameters bEnable bool Set to non-zero to enable regex, set to zero to disable regex. Everything_SetRequestFlags(uint) The Everything_SetRequestFlags function sets the desired result data. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setrequestflags/ public static extern void Everything_SetRequestFlags(uint dwRequestFlags) Parameters dwRequestFlags uint The request flags, can be zero or more of the following flags: EVERYTHING_REQUEST_FILE_NAME (0x00000001) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_PATH (0x00000002) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_FULL_PATH_A(0x00000004) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_EXTENSION (0x00000008) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_SIZE (0x00000010) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_DATE_CREATE(0x00000020) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_DATE_MODIFI(0x00000040) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_DATE_ACCESS(0x00000080) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_ATTRIBUTES (0x00000100) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_FILE_LIST_F(0x00000200) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_RUN_COUNT (0x00000400) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_DATE_RUN (0x00000800) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_DATE_RECENT(0x00001000) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_HIGHLIGHTED(0x00002000) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_HIGHLIGHTED(0x00004000) EVERYTHING_REQUEST_HIGHLIGHTED(0x00008000) Everything_SetSearchW(string) The Everything_SetSearch function sets the search string for the IPC Query. https://www.voidtools.com/support/everything/sdk/everything_setsearch/ public static extern uint Everything_SetSearchW(string lpSearchString) Parameters lpSearchString string A string to be used as the new search text. Returns uint This function has no return value. OnQueryChange(string) Executes the query, obtains the relevant information for each item from Everything and then creates EverythingItems for them public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string Returns List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string) public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The EverythingSignifier (Since there is only 1 signifier for this plugin), followed by the file / folder being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of files / folders that possibly match what is being searched for

api/Plugin_Everything.ShellContextMenu.h.keywords: Class ShellContextMenu Namespace Plugin_Everything Assembly Plugin_Everything.dll "Stand-alone" shell context menu Create an instance and call ShowContextMenu with a list of FileInfo for the files. Limitation is that it only handles files in the same directory but it can be fixed by changing the way files are translated into PIDLs. Based on FileBrowser in C# from CodeProject http://www.codeproject.com/useritems/FileBrowser.asp Hooking class taken from MSDN Magazine Cutting Edge column http://msdn.microsoft.com/msdnmag/issues/02/10/CuttingEdge/ Andreas Johansson afjohansson@hotmail.com http://afjohansson.spaces.live.com public class ShellContextMenu : NativeWindow, IWin32Window Inheritance object MarshalByRefObject NativeWindow ShellContextMenu Implements IWin32Window Inherited Members NativeWindow.AssignHandle(IntPtr) NativeWindow.CreateHandle(CreateParams) NativeWindow.DefWndProc(ref Message) NativeWindow.DestroyHandle() NativeWindow.FromHandle(IntPtr) NativeWindow.OnHandleChange() NativeWindow.OnThreadException(Exception) NativeWindow.ReleaseHandle() NativeWindow.Handle MarshalByRefObject.MemberwiseClone(bool) MarshalByRefObject.GetLifetimeService() MarshalByRefObject.InitializeLifetimeService() MarshalByRefObject.CreateObjRef(Type) object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Examples ShellContextMenu scm = new ShellContextMenu(); FileInfo[] files = new FileInfo[1]; files[0] = new FileInfo(@"c:\windows\notepad.exe"); scm.ShowContextMenu(this.Handle, files, Cursor.Position); Constructors ShellContextMenu() Default constructor public ShellContextMenu() Methods ~ShellContextMenu() Ensure all resources get released protected ~ShellContextMenu() FreePIDLs(IntPtr[]) Free the PIDLs protected void FreePIDLs(IntPtr[] arrPIDLs) Parameters arrPIDLs IntPtr[] Array of PIDLs (IntPtr) GetPIDLs(DirectoryInfo[]) Get the PIDLs protected IntPtr[] GetPIDLs(DirectoryInfo[] arrFI) Parameters arrFI DirectoryInfo[] Array of DirectoryInfo Returns IntPtr[] Array of PIDLs GetPIDLs(FileInfo[]) Get the PIDLs protected IntPtr[] GetPIDLs(FileInfo[] arrFI) Parameters arrFI FileInfo[] Array of FileInfo Returns IntPtr[] Array of PIDLs ShowContextMenu(DirectoryInfo[], Point) Shows the context menu public void ShowContextMenu(DirectoryInfo[] dirs, Point pointScreen) Parameters dirs DirectoryInfo[] DirectoryInfos (should all be in same directory) pointScreen Point Where to show the menu ShowContextMenu(FileInfo[], Point) Shows the context menu public void ShowContextMenu(FileInfo[] files, Point pointScreen) Parameters files FileInfo[] FileInfos (should all be in same directory) pointScreen Point Where to show the menu WndProc(ref Message) This method receives WindowMessages. It will make the "Open With" and "Send To" work by calling HandleMenuMsg and HandleMenuMsg2. It will also call the OnContextMenuMouseHover method of Browser when hovering over a ContextMenu item. protected override void WndProc(ref Message m) Parameters m Message the Message of the Browser's WndProc

api/Plugin_Gitmoji.Plugin_Gitmoji.html.keywords: Class Plugin_Gitmoji Namespace Plugin_Gitmoji Assembly Plugin_Gitmoji.dll The Gitmoji plugin public class Plugin_Gitmoji : Plugin Inheritance object Plugin Plugin_Gitmoji Inherited Members Plugin.OnAppShutdown() Plugin.OnAppStartup() Plugin.OnSearchWindowStartup() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors Plugin_Gitmoji() Loads plugin settings public Plugin_Gitmoji() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() Used to define signifiers (prefixes) to produce commands that should take in extra information (after the prefix) to produce unique results. When a query starting with one of these signifiers is entered by the user, OnSignifier(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The signifiers defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The GitmojiSignifier from plugin settings OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> Matching emojis OnSignifier(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to include a command signifier, provided by CommandSignifiers(), at the beginning of their query. Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The GitmojiSignifier (Since there is only 1 signifier for this plugin), followed by the emoji being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of emojis that possibly match what is being searched for OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The AllEmojiSpecialCommand (Since there is only 1 special command for this plugin) Returns List<ListItem> All emojis within the gitmoji convention sorted alphabetically SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The AllEmojiSpecialCommand from plugin settings

api/Plugin_InstalledApps.InstalledApps.h.keywords: Class InstalledApps Namespace Plugin_InstalledApps Assembly Plugin_InstalledApps.dll The Installed Apps plugin public class InstalledApps : Plugin Inheritance object InstalledApps Constructors InstalledApps() public InstalledApps() Properties PluggerName public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The InstalledAppsSignifier from plugin settings OnAppStartup() Creates the list of all installed apps public override void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The app being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of InstalledApps that possibly match what is being searched for OnSignifier(string) public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The InstalledAppsSignifier (Since there is only 1 signifier for this plugin), followed by the app being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of InstalledApps that possibly match what is being searched for OnSpecialCommand(string) public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The AllAppsSpecialCommand from plugin settings (Since there is only 1 special command for this plugin) Returns List<ListItem> All Apps sorted alphabetically + a shortcut to shell:appsFolder SpecialCommands() public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The AllAppsSpecialCommand from plugin settings

api/Plugin_InstalledApps.Settings.html.keywords: Class Settings Namespace Plugin_InstalledApps Assembly Plugin_InstalledApps.dll The settings for this (Installed Apps) plugin public class Settings Inheritance object Settings Inherited Members object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors Settings() public Settings() Properties AllAppsSpecialCommand The command to show all Installed Apps found (defaults to 'AllApps') public string AllAppsSpecialCommand { get; set; } Property Value string BlackList List of application names to not show (defaults to empty - all apps can be shown) public List<string> BlackList { get; set; } Property Value List<string> FuzzySearchThreshold The threshold for when to consider an application name is similar enough to the query for it to be displayed (defaults to 4). api/Plugin_PortableApps.PortableApps.htm.keywords: Class PortableApps Namespace Plugin_PortableApps Assembly Plugin_PortableApps.dll The Portable Apps Plugin public class PortableApps : Plugin Inheritance object PortableApps Constructors PortableApps() Loads the plugin's settings public PortableApps() Properties PluggerName public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The PortableAppsSignifier from plugin settings OnAppStartup() Creates the list of all portable apps public override void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The app being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of PortableApps that possibly match what is being searched for OnSignifier(string) public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The PortableAppsSignifier (Since there is only 1 signifier for this plugin), followed by the app being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of PortableApps that possibly match what is being searched for OnSpecialCommand(string) public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The 'all apps' command (Since there is only 1 special command for this plugin) Returns List<ListItem> All Apps sorted alphabetically + a shortcut to the portable apps folder SpecialCommands() public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The AllAppsSpecialCommand from plugin settings

api/Plugin_PortableApps.Settings.html.title: Class Settings | QuokkaDocs
api/Plugin_PortableApps.Settings.html.keywords: Class Settings Namespace Plugin_PortableApps Assembly Plugin_PortableApps.dll The settings for this (Portable Apps) plugin public class Settings Inheritance object Settings Inherited Members object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors Settings() public Settings() Properties AllAppsSpecialCommand The command to show all Portable Apps found (defaults to 'AllPortableApps') public string AllAppsSpecialCommand { get; set; } Property Value string BlackList List of application names to not show (defaults to empty - all apps can be shown) public List<string> BlackList { get; set; } Property Value List<string> FuzzySearchThreshold The threshold for when to consider an application name is similar enough to the query for it to be displayed (defaults to 5). Currently uses the Levenshtein distance; the larger the number, the bigger the difference. public int FuzzySearchThreshold { get; set; } Property Value int PortableAppsDirectory The directory in which portable apps are saved (defaults to "\PortableApps") public string PortableAppsDirectory { get; set; } Property Value string PortableAppsSignifier The command signifier to show only portable apps (defaults to "portapp ") Using this signifier does not change the output of this plugin, it only ensures that no other plugins' results are included in the search window results list public string PortableAppsSignifier { get; set; } Property Value string

api/Plugin_PowerCommands.PowerCommands.h.title: Class PowerCommands | QuokkaDocs
api/Plugin_PowerCommands.PowerCommands.h.keywords: Class PowerCommands Namespace Plugin_PowerCommands Assembly Plugin_PowerCommands.dll The Power Commands plugin public class PowerCommands : Plugin Inheritance object Plugin PowerCommands Inherited Members Plugin.OnAppShutdown() Plugin.OnAppStartup() Plugin.OnSearchWindowStartup() Plugin.OnSignifier(string) Plugin.CommandSignifiers() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors PowerCommands() Creates the plugin, loading the plugins settings public PowerCommands() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. Provides the relevant power commands close enough (fuzzy search) to either the command in settings or it's name. 'Sign Out' is also compared to 'log off' public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> power commands that are close enough to the query OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. Provides the respective power command or all of them if the query is the AllPowerCommandsCommand public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> the respective power command SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The commands in settings (all power commands are special commands)

api/Plugin_Settings.Settings.html.title: Class Settings | QuokkaDocs
api/Plugin_Settings.Settings.html.keywords: Class Settings Namespace Plugin_Settings Assembly Plugin_Settings.dll The settings plugin public class Settings : Plugin Inheritance object Plugin Settings Inherited Members Plugin.OnAppShutdown() Plugin.OnAppStartup() Plugin.OnSearchWindowStartup() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Constructors Settings() Loads plugin settings public Settings() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public override string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() Used to define signifiers (prefixes) to produce commands that should take in extra information (after the prefix) to produce unique results. When a query starting with one of these signifiers is entered by the user, OnSignifier(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The signifiers defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The signifiers from plugin settings (SettingsSignifier, EitherSettingsTypeSignifier, ControlPanelSignifier) OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> Any settings pages that match the query OnSignifier(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to include a command signifier, provided by CommandSignifiers(), at the beginning of their query. Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public override List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string A command signifier for this plugin, followed by the settings page being searched for Returns List<ListItem> List of settings pages that possibly match what is being searched for OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. Provides all the settings pages for the relevant special command public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> all the relevant settings pages SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The commands in settings (AllWindowsSettingsCommand, AllControlPanelSettingsCommand, AllSettingsCommand)

api/Quokka.PluginArch.IPlugger.html.keywords: Interface IPlugger Namespace Quokka.PluginArch Assembly Quokka.dll All plugins must implement this interface. public interface IPlugger Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods OnAppShutdown() This method will run just before the application shuts down, i.e., when the user clicks 'exit' in the tray task context menu. Useful for any clean-up required. void OnAppShutdown() OnAppStartup() This method will run just after the application starts up, e.g., when the user runs Quokka.exe. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnSearchWindowStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the user's query. These will be displayed in the search windows results list OnSearchWindowStartup() This method will run just after the search window starts up. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnAppStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. void OnSearchWindowStartup() OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The command the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the command. These will be displayed in the search windows results list SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The special commands; the commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins.

api/Quokka.PluginArch.Plugin.html.title: Class Plugin | QuokkaDocs
api/Quokka.PluginArch.Plugin.html.keywords: Class Plugin Namespace Quokka.PluginArch Assembly Quokka.dll All plugins must implement this. public abstract class Plugin Inheritance object Plugin Derived DeviceAddresses EnglishDictionary Plugin_Gitmoji PowerCommands Settings ShellCommand UnicodeCharacterLookup WebSearch WindowSwitch Plugin_Workflows Plugin_Quokka Inherited Members object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() Constructors Plugin() protected Plugin() Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin public abstract string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods CommandSignifiers() Used to define signifiers (prefixes) to produce commands that should take in extra information (after the prefix) to produce unique results. When a query starting with one of these signifiers is entered by the user, OnSignifier(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The signifiers defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public virtual List<string> CommandSignifiers() Returns List<string> The command signifiers; the signifiers defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. Default behavior when not overridden: returns an empty list. Default behavior when not overridden: does nothing. public virtual void OnAppShutdown() OnAppStartup() This method will run just after the application starts up, e.g., when the user runs Quokka.exe. Useful for any required resource gathering; there is an OnSearchWindowStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public abstract List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the user's query. These will be displayed in the search windows results list OnSearchWindowStartup() This method will run just after the search window starts up. Useful for any required resource gathering; there is an OnAppStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. Default behavior when not overridden: does nothing. public virtual void OnSearchWindowStartup() OnSignifier(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to include a command signifier, provided by CommandSignifiers(), at the beginning of their query. Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public virtual List<ListItem> OnSignifier(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the signifier and extra information that proceeded it. Default behavior when not overridden: returns an empty list. OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public virtual List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the command. These will be displayed in the search windows results list. Default behavior when not overridden: returns an empty list. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public virtual List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The special commands; the commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. api/Quokka.Settings.SettingParsers.html.title: Class SettingParsers | QuokkaDocs
api/Quokka.Settings.SettingParsers.html.keywords: Class SettingParsers Namespace Quokka.Settings Assembly Quokka.dll All of the methods for parsing and evaluating different types of app settings. public static class SettingParsers Inheritance object SettingParsers Inherited Members object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() Methods parseCornerRadiusSetting(string) Parses and evaluates CornerRadius settings. public static CornerRadius parseCornerRadiusSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns CornerRadius The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, a corner radius of 0 is returned. parseDoubleSetting(string) Parses and evaluates double settings (i.e., of double type). public static double parseDoubleSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns double The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, 0 is returned. parseHorizontalAlignmentSetting(string) Parses and evaluates HorizontalAlignment settings. public static HorizontalAlignment parseHorizontalAlignmentSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns HorizontalAlignment The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, HorizontalAlignment.Center is returned. parseIntegerSetting(string) Parses and evaluates integer settings (i.e., of integer type). public static int parseIntegerSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns int The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, 0 is returned and an error message is show to the user. parseRenderingBiasSetting(string) Parses and evaluates RenderingBias settings. public static RenderingBias parseRenderingBiasSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns RenderingBias The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, RenderingBias.Quality is returned. parseScreenDimensionsSetting(string) Parses and evaluates settings that can have ScreenHeight and ScreenWidth values in them (i.e., the "WindowTopMargin", "WindowWidth" and "ListContainerMaxHeight" settings). public static double parseScreenDimensionsSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns double The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, 0 is returned. parseThicknessSetting(string) Parses and evaluates Thickness settings. public static Thickness parseThicknessSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns Thickness The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, a thickness of 0 is returned. parseVerticalAlignmentSetting(string) Parses and evaluates VerticalAlignment settings. public static VerticalAlignment parseVerticalAlignmentSetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns VerticalAlignment The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, VerticalAlignment.Center is returned. parseVisibilitySetting(string) Parses and evaluates Visibility settings. public static Visibility parseVisibilitySetting(string settingValue) Parameters settingValue string The value of a setting to be evaluated. Returns Visibility The setting value evaluated. If the setting cannot be evaluated correctly, Visibility.Visible is returned.

Useful for any required resource gathering; there is an OnSearchWindowStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. Default behavior when not overridden: does nothing. Checks for updates, if CheckForUpdates (in settings) is true public override void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. public override List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> An empty list OnSpecialCommand(string) Provides the AboutQuokkaItem public override List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The query the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> The AboutQuokkaItem SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public override List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The AboutCommand in settings
